gurmukhi: AQ rwjsU j`g isspwl bD kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Raajsoo Jagg Sispaal Badh Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of the Rajsui Yajna and the killing of Shishupal

gurmukhi: auq sIs invwie gey niRp Dwm ieqY jdurwie id`lI mih AwXo ]BIm kihE sB Byd su mY blu XwhI qy pwie kY S`qiH GwXo ]
transliteration: Out Sees Nivaae Gad Nrip Dhaam Itai Jaduraae Dillimaih Aayo|| Bheem Kahio Sabh Bhed Su Mai Bal(u) Yaahite Paae Kai Shattrah(i) Ghaayo||
translation: On that side, the kings went to their homes and on this side Krishna reached Delhi; Bhima told all that he got strength from Krishna and thus killed the enemy;

gurmukhi: ib`pR bulwie BlI ibiD so iPr rwjsUAau iek j`gu rcwXo ]AwrMB j`g ko BXo qb hI jsu duMdB jo biRjnwQ bjwXo ]2331]
transliteration: Bippra Bulaae Bhalibidh(i) So Phir Raajsooau Ik Jagg(u) Rchadyo|| Ooranbh Jagg Ko Bhayo Tab Hijas(u) Doundabh Jo Brijnaath Bajaayo||2331||
translation: Then calling the Brahmins respectfully, the Rajsui Yajna was begun and this Yajna began with the playing of the drum of Krishna.2331.
Speech of Yudhishtar addressed to the Court:

gurmukhi: jor sBw d?i?j C`qRn kI piRQmY niRp XO khXo kaun mn`ieXY ]ko ieh lwiek bIr eIhw ijh Bwl mY kuMkm A`Cq l`ieXY ]
transliteration: Jor Sabhaa Dvij Chhattran Kiprithmai Nrip Yau Kahyo Kaoun Manaeyai|| Ko Eh Laaik Beer Eehaa Jih Dhaal Mai Kounkam Achchhat Laeyai||
translation: In the court of Kshatriyas and Brahmins, the king said, “Who should primarily be worshipped? Who is the most deserving person here, on whose forehead the saffron and other ingredients be applied?

gurmukhi: bol auTXo shdyv qbY biRjnwiek lwiek Xwh cV`ieXY ]sRI biRj nwQ shI pRB hY kib sXwm BnY ijh ky bil j`ieXY ]2332]
transliteration: Bol Outhyo Sahdev Tabai Brijnaaik Laaik Yaah Chataeyai|| Sribrij Naath Sahiprabh Hai Kabi Syaam Bhanai Jih Ke Bal(i) Jaeyai||2332||
translation: Sahdev said, “Only Krishna is the most suitable; he is the real Lord and we all are a sacrifice to him.”2332.

gurmukhi: jwhI kI syv sdw krIAY mn Aaur n kwjn mY aurJ`ieXY ]Cor jNjwr sBY giH ky iqh ipAwn ky BIqr ic`q lg`ieXY ]
transliteration: Jaahikisev Sadaadareeai Man Aur Na Kaajan Mai Urjhaeyai|| Chhodh Janjaar Sabhai Grah(i) Ke Tih Dhiaan Ke Bheetar Chitt Lagadyai||
translation: “O mind ! always serve him and do not entangle yourself in other matter; abandoning all the entanglements, absorb your mind only in Krishna;

gurmukhi: jwhI ko Bydu purwnn qy mq swDn bydn qy kCU p`ieXY ]qw hI ko sXwm BnY pRQmY auT kY ikau n kuMkm Bwl lg`ieXY ]2333]
transliteration: Jaah(i) Ko Bhed(u) Puraanan Te Mat Saadhan Bedan Te Kachhodh Paeyai|| Taa Hiko Syaam Bhanai Prathmai Outh Kai Kioo Na Kounkam Dhaal Lagadyai||2333||
translation: His mystery is more or less, obtained by us in Vedas and Purana and in the company of the saints; therefore primarily, the saffron and other ingredients be applied to the forehead of Krishna.”2333.

gurmukhi: XoN jb bYn khY shdyv qy BUpq ky mn mY scu AwXo ]sRI biRjnwiek ko mn mY kib sXwm shI pRB kY ThrwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Jab Bain Kahai Sahdev Te Bhoopat Ke Man Mai Sach(u) Aayo|| Sribrijnaaik Ko Man Mai Kabi Syaam Sahiprabh Kai Thahraayo||
translation: This speech of Sahdev was considered by all us true and in their minds they visualised him as Lord-god;

gurmukhi: kuMkm A`Cq BwNiq BlI kir bydn kI Dun Bwl cVwXo ]bYTo huqo isspwl qhwN Aiq so Apno mn bIc irswXo ]2334]
transliteration: Kounkam Achchhat Bhaant(i) Bhalikar(i) Bedan Kidhoun Dhaal Chadaayo|| Baitho Houto Sispaal Tahaan At(i) So Apno Man Beech Risaayo||2334||
translation: Within the chanting of Vedic mantras, the saffron and other ingredients were applied on the forehead of Krihsna, seeing which, Shishupal sitting there, became extremely infuriated.2334.
